PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_DuctDesignCriteria
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IAI: This property set is used to define the general characteristics of the duct design parameters. This property set is typically attached to an instance of an IfcSystem, however, it may also be attached to individual elements within a duct distribution system where individual design parameters overrule those of the system. HISTORY: New property set in IFC Release 2.0.

PropertyDef.Name: DesignName
PropertyDef.Definition: A name for the design values

PropertyDef.Name: DuctSizingMethod
PropertyDef.Definition: Enumeration that identifies the methodology to be used to size system components

PropertyDef.Name: PressureClass
PropertyDef.Definition: Nominal pressure rating of the system components. (Data type = PressureMeasure)

PropertyDef.Name: LeakageClass
PropertyDef.Definition: Nominal leakage rating for the system components.

PropertyDef.Name: FrictionLoss
PropertyDef.Definition: The pressure loss due to friction per unit length. (Data type = PressureMeasure/LengthMeasure)

PropertyDef.Name: DuctSealant
PropertyDef.Definition: Type of sealant used on the duct and fittings

PropertyDef.Name: MaximumVelocity
PropertyDef.Definition: The maximum design velocity of the air in the duct or fitting.

PropertyDef.Name: MinimumHeight
PropertyDef.Definition: The minimum duct height for rectangular, oval or round duct

PropertyDef.Name: MinimumWidth
PropertyDef.Definition: The minimum duct width for oval or rectangular duct
